Entry.JapaneseText: そっか……戒律のせいで しゃべれないんだったネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right... Can't speak because of the commandments.

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、男とは 話せないようだな……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that you can't talk to men because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか、戒律が あったんだったな……
Entry.EnglishText: Man... So we really can't talk because of the Commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、女と 話せないんだったわね……
Entry.EnglishText: Because of the commandments, you aren't allowed to talk to women....

Entry.JapaneseText: 売りたそうにしているが、 戒律のせいで、異性とは 話ができないようだ。
Entry.EnglishText: He looks like he wants to sell, but because of the commandments, he can't seem to talk to the opposite sex.

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード・リフトの管理人の家
<speed:00>『棚の中身』 ていねいに折りたたまれた 布がたくさん入っている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00>"Shelf's Contents" A lot of carefully folded clothes are located within.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00>『リフト客室のシートカバー』 街と港とをつなぐリフトの座席用カバー。 グリーンは男性用、オレンジは女性用。 管理人さんが毎日取り替え、洗っている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00>"Seat Covers for the Lift Cabins" Covers for the lift that connect the city and the port. Green for Men, Orange for Women. The Janitor changes and washes them every day.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00>『箱の中身』 管理人さんが新規考案中の 高速リフトの検討用模型。 失敗作もあるが、捨てるに 捨てられず、かといって自宅に 持ち帰ると奥さんに叱られるので ここに詰め込んである。
Entry.EnglishText:
<speed:00> "Contents of the Box" A set of models for examination of the high-speed lift that the caretaker is inventing.
"Some of them are failures, but I couldn't throw them away, and my wife would scold me if I brought them home, so I packed them in here."

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00>『高速リフト設計図』 管理人さんが新規考案中の 高速リフトの設計図。 「理論上は、目にも止まらぬ速さで 街から港へ降りる事が可能だが、 乗っている人はおしりがモゾモゾ するはずだ」……というのが 管理人さんのコメント。
Entry.EnglishText:
<speed:00> "High Speed Lift Blueprint" A blueprint for a new high-speed lift being devised by the lift caretaker.
"Theoretically, it could take you down from the city to the port at blinding speed, but it would make your hips squirm." - Comment from the Lift Caretaker

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00>『水がめ』 蒼の聖殿の横にある滝から 汲んで来た、とてもおいしい水。 何日置いておいても悪くならず、 人々は「蒼獣様の涙」だと言って ありがたがり、好んで飲む。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00> "Mizugame" Very tasty water from the waterfall next to the Azure Shrine. The water does not go bad even if it is left for several days, and people appreciate the exquisite taste, even calling it the "Azure Beast's Tears".

Entry.JapaneseText: リフトは荷物の積み下ろしが終わったら、 戻ってくるよ。 それまで待ってくんな。

Entry.EnglishText: It's no good... The lift is...

Entry.JapaneseText: 祭司様の命令なら リフトを動かしてもいいが……
Entry.EnglishText: For the Priest... I'm willing to let you use the lift...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000020>ん？ リフトか？ すまんな、今荷物を 下に送ったばかりなんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000020>Hm? You need the lift? Sorry, I just sent it down with some cargo.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000022>さあな。下で荷物の 積み下ろしが終わったら、 返ってくるだろうが…… しばらくはかかるな。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000022>Who knows? It should return after they finish unloading the cargo down below, but... that's going to take a while.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000024>焦ってもしかたがない。 街の中を見て回ろう。 <Blue>王の盾<White>について何か 話を聞けるかもしれない。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000024>I know you're in a hurry, but we just have to wait. Let's walk around town for now. We might hear something about the <Blue>Royal Shield<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000036>リフトには、 乗れるようになったか？
<voice:1c000038>ボクたち急いでるんだ。 リフトに乗せてヨ、お願い。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000038>We're really in a hurry. Let us ride the lift, please!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00003a>そんな事言わずに 頼むよ……なっ！
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C00003A>Aw come on, you can do us a favor just this once, please?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00003c>くっ……なんだ、こいつ…… メチャクチャ強えぇ……能力者か!? <Mao>、フォルスは？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C00003C>Gh... What the heck... He's ridiculously strong... Is he a Force user!? <Mao>, do you sense anything?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00003d>フォルスキューブは 反応してないけど……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C00003D>I'm not getting any reaction from the Force Cube, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00003e>ん……？ この感じ、 前にどこかで……
<voice:1c000041>待て！ <Tytree>！ 彼は操られているんだ。
<voice:1c000043>ああ、<Yellow>音のフォルス<White>で 暗示をかけられているに違いない。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000043>Yes, he must be under the influence of the <Yellow>Force of Sound<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000044>近くに、<Blue>王の盾<White>が いるのかもしれない。
<voice:1c000047>さっき、この街の娘が 俺に直接謝ってきた…… だが、それは蒼獣信仰の戒律に 反するんじゃなかったのか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000047>Earlier, a girl from this town bumped into me and apologized to me, but wouldn't that have gone against the commandments of the Blue Beast Faith?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000048>さっきの娘は、この街の 住民じゃなかったんだわ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000048>Then that must mean those girls weren't from around here.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000049>でも、この街の人の 格好してたヨ！
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000049>But they looked like they were from around here!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00004a>私たちの目を欺くためだとしたら？ そして、わざわざそんな事をする 必要があるのは……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C00004A>They must have done that to deceive us, right? And the only people who would need to do such a thing...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00004b><Blue>王の盾<White>!! あの女の人は、<Blue>王の盾<White>に さらわれた人だったんですね!!
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C00004B>...Would be the <Blue>Royal Shield<White>! Those were the kidnapped girls!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00004f>待て、<Veigue>！ 素人がいじるのはやめた方がいい。 それよりも彼の暗示を解く音を 探す事が先決だ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C00004F>Don't, <Veigue>! If you don't know how it works, you shouldn't operate it. Let's search for the catalyst to release this man instead.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000050>おいおい、何が何だかさっぱりだぜ。 この人がワルトゥってヤツに 操られてるのはわかったけど、 暗示を解く音ってなんの事だよ？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000050>Whoa, guys, slow down for a second! I get that this guy is being controlled by some guy called Walto, but what's this about a catalyst?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000051>ワルトゥの<Yellow>音のフォルス<White>は、 ある音をきっかけにして行動するよう 人に暗示をかけるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000051>Walto uses his <Yellow>Force of Sound<White> to set a specific sound as a catalyst to place a person under his control.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000052>この人の暗示を解くには、 きっかけとなった音と同じ音を 聞かせるしかないんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000052>In order to free them, we need to make them hear the same sound again.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000053>音を探せって事？ 音が鳴りそうなものなんて、 いっぱいあるじゃない。 そんなの無理だわ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000053>We'll need to look for a sound? But there are so many things around here that can make noises, it seems impossible to be able to find the right one.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000054>ワルトゥは、必要以上に フォルスで人を操る事を嫌う。 作戦終了後に、必ずその暗示を 解くのがヤツの流儀だ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000054>Walto dislikes using his Force to control people longer than necessary. He's the type of person to release people from their hypnosis once he's accomplished his goal.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000055>同時にそれは、 全ての行動の痕跡を 消す事にもなる。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000055>When that happens, any traces of his actions will be erased as well.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000056>ヤツはそのための協力者を 必ず用意している。 おそらく、この街のどこかに、 その協力者がいるはずだ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000056>He always uses an accomplice to help him with that. Said accomplice is most likely somewhere in this city.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000057>なるほど、そいつを見つければ、 この管理人の暗示のきっかけが 何かわかるってワケだな？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000057>I get it, so if we find his accomplice, we'll be able to figure out what kind of sound is being used to control the lift operator?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000059>よっしゃ、管理人さんの暗示を解く 音をその協力者から聞き出して、 姉貴と<Claire>さんを助けようぜ！ なっ、<Veigue>。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000059>All right! Let's find them and get 'em to tell us the catalyst so we can release the lift operator and save Claire and my sister! Right, <Veigue>?

Entry.JapaneseText: 暗示を解くキーワードは？

Entry.EnglishText: It's no good... The lift is...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00008c>リフトで港に行きたいんだ。 動かしてくれるか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C00008C>We'd like to take the lift down to the harbor. Will you let us ride it?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00008d>ああ、そういやさっき 来てたっけな。 荷物は運び終わったから 乗せてやるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C00008D>Ah, now that you mention it, it just came back. You can ride it once the cargo is unloaded.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00008f>それじゃ、 俺は先に行ってリフトを 動かしてるからな。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C00008F>All right, I'll go on ahead and get the lift moving for you.

Entry.JapaneseText: 正確な言葉でなければ 暗示を解く事はできないぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: You can't break the hypnosis unless you use the exact keyword.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3a00003c>あんたら、どうやって ここまで来たんだ!?
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3A00003C>How did you people get all the way here?!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3a00003d>登山洞を上がってきたんだヨ。
<voice:3a00003e>……なんだって……？ じゃあ、登山洞の岩を……？ なんて事だ……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3A00003E>You what? So the stones blocking the Cavern are gone? How in the world...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3a00003f>そんな事より…… リフトを動かしてくれない？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3A00003F>That's not important. Will you start operating the lift again?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3a000040>ダメだ、リフトを動かしたら、 ガジュマが上がってきちまう！
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3A000040>No way. If the lift goes back into operation, then the Gajuma will be able to come up here!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3a000041>動かさないと、今度は あんたの血しぶきが上がるよ？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3A000041>If that lift doesn't go up, then next time you might just get cut up.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3a000042>う……動かしたかったら、 祭司様に頼めよ！
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3A000042>I-if you want it working so badly, go ask the priest!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3a000043>祭司様もウンとは 言わないだろうがね！
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3A000043>Though I doubt he'll just say "Sure, go ahead!"

Entry.JapaneseText: このままでは暗示は解けない…… 祭司の手伝いをした人の家族に 話を聞けば暗示の言葉がわかるかもしれない……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't break the hypnosis at this rate.... If we talk to the family of the person who helped the priest, we might be able to find out what the keyword is...

Entry.JapaneseText: 暗示を解く言葉がわからないヨ！ 祭司の手伝いをした人の家族に 話を聞きに行こうヨ！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't know the words to break the spell! Let's go talk to the family of the person who helped the priest!

Entry.JapaneseText: 暗示を解く言葉は、 祭司の手伝いをした人の家族に 話を聞けばわかるかもしれないぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: We might be able to find the words to break the hypnosis by talking to the family of the person who helped the priest.

Entry.JapaneseText: 暗示を解く前に、 祭司の手伝いをした人の家族に 話を聞きに行きましょう。
Entry.EnglishText: Before we can undo the hypnosis, we must go talk to the family of the person who helped the priest.

Entry.JapaneseText: ちょっと待てよ、暗示の言葉が わかんねえだろ？ 祭司の手伝いをした人の家族に 話を聞きに行った方がいいんじゃねえか？
Entry.EnglishText: Wait a minute. We don't have any idea about what the keyword is, right? Wouldn't it be better to go talk to the family of the person who helped the priest?

Entry.JapaneseText: 祭司の手伝いをした人の家族に 話を聞きにいきましょう。 これじゃ暗示の言葉なんてわからないわ。
Entry.EnglishText: Let's go talk to the family of the person who helped the priest. They may tell us something related to the hypnosis-breaking keyword.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00><scale:0140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00><scale:0140>Would you like to rest? Yes No
